ScreenDetails.summary: NOTE Experimental The ScreenDetails interface of the Window Management API represents the details of all the screens available to the user's device.

remarks.para: This information is accessed via the method.

blockquote.para: ScreenDetails is a live object, meaning that it updates as the available screens change. You can therefore keep querying the same object to get updated values, rather than repeatedly calling getScreenDetails().

ScreenDetailsScreens.summary:
NOTE Experimental The screens read-only property of the
interface contains an array of objects, each one representing detailed information about one specific screen available to the user's device.
ScreenDetailsScreens.value:
An array of objects.
NOTEscreens only includes "extended" displays, not those that mirror another display.

ScreenDetailsCurrentScreen.summary:
NOTE Experimental The currentScreen read-only property of the
interface contains a single object representing detailed information about the screen that the current browser window is displayed in.

ScreenDetailsScreenschange.summary: NOTE Experimental The screenschange event of the interface is fired when the set of screens available to the system has changed: that is, a new screen has become available or an existing screen has become unavailable. This will be reflected in a change in the array.
